content: i've run into a small mismatch in formalisation... at the step of applying lt_dist (2.0.36), i need ğ“˜ p â‰¤ ğ“˜ u', but i only have (ğ“˜ p : Set X) âŠ† ğ“˜ u' (from applying if_descendant_then_subset for (ğ“˜ p : Set X) âŠ† ğ“˜ u and fundamental_dyadic for (ğ“˜ u : Set X) âŠ† ğ“˜ u'). in principle we do have s (ğ“˜ u) â‰¤ s (ğ“˜ u'), but i don't know i can get s (ğ“˜ p) â‰¤ s (ğ“˜ u)
another way to fix this could be that the âŠ‚\subsetâŠ‚ in the hypothesis in (2.0.36) is meant to be formalised as âŠ† rather than â‰¤

carleson#TileStructure.Forest.smul_four_le should give you s (ğ“˜ p') â‰¤ s (ğ“˜ u'), after unfolding the definition of â‰¤ in the Lemma statement (and you already know s (ğ“˜ p) â‰¤ s (ğ“˜ u')). Please add that as lemma about Forest.

Great you asked this, turned out it was exactly the lemma that I was missing in my proof too (Lemma 7.5.11).
I'll create a separate PR with this lemma so that we can both use it.
i am glad to announce the proof is sorry-free! (locally)
